intro: Clutia eckloniana, commonly known as the Cape clutia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, often with red or purple bracts. It is commonly found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Clutia eckloniana is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant.
